intro: Scrophularia xanthoglossa var. xanthoglossa, commonly known as the yellow-lipped scrophularia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, hairy texture. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow flowers with two lips, characteristic of the Scrophulariaceae family. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered with a fine pubescence. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats.
